summary:
Dermatophytosis, or ringworm, is a common fungal skin infection. It causes red, itchy, circular rashes and can affect the skin, hair, and nails. Symptoms appear a week or two after contact. It's often named based on the affected body part.

You can catch it from animals or people, especially in public places like showers. Keeping your skin dry and not sharing personal items can help prevent it. Treatment usually involves antifungal creams, but oral medication might be needed for severe cases. Ringworm is global and can affect anyone, but some types are more common in specific age groups or genders.
title: Dermatophytosis
